Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a burnished cream-coloured slip, which has flaked away in many places, and with remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text identifying contents as [meat] for birth of Aten (New Year's Day).
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 84
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393157) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393157)
Associated events: Named in Inscription: Birth of Aten
